Package ch.hepia.devices.status

Interface Status

All Known Implementing Classes:
Status.Err, Status.Off, Status.On
public interface Status
Status that can be one of these three states: On, Off et Err
Author:
Cavat Joel
See Also:
Status.On, Status.Off, Status.Err, Device

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type Interface Description
    static class  Status.Err
    Representation a operational status with an error
    static class  Status.Off
    Representation a non operational status
    static class  Status.On
    Representation an operational status

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    default java.lang.String getErrorMessage()
    Return the error message if the status is an error.
    boolean isError()
    Return true if the status represents an error
    boolean isOff()
    Return true if the status is off
    boolean isOn()
    Return true if the status is running
    static Status process()
    Return a status randomly

  • Method Details

    • isOn

      boolean isOn()
      Return true if the status is running
      Returns:
      true if the status is running

    • isOff

      boolean isOff()
      Return true if the status is off
      Returns:
      true if the status is off

    • isError

      boolean isError()
      Return true if the status represents an error
      Returns:
      true if the status represents an error

    • getErrorMessage

      default java.lang.String getErrorMessage() throws java.util.NoSuchElementException
      Return the error message if the status is an error. Don't forget to check the status first.
      Returns:
      the error message if the status is an error.
      Throws:
      java.util.NoSuchElementException - if the status is not an error
      See Also:
      isError()

    • process

      static Status process()
      Return a status randomly
      Returns:
      a status
      See Also:
      Status.On, Status.Off, Status.Err
